revised_title: Role of Raf Proto-Oncogene in Caenorhabditis Elegans Vulval Development
tldr: This article explores the role of the raf proto-oncogene in the development of the vulva in Caenorhabditis elegans. The study reveals that the raf kinase gene, lin-45, acts downstream of the ras gene during vulval induction. The research contributes to understanding the molecular pathways involved in cell signaling and organogenesis in C. elegans.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
